About the Role: 

We‚Äôre looking for a senior-level SysOps Engineer with deep Linux expertise who is passionate about creating reliable, scalable infrastructure. While our current stack heavily features on-prem infrastructure (Linux, bare-metal, virtualization, networking), we‚Äôre actively moving toward a hybrid/cloud environment (AWS/Kubernetes).

-Time-Series DataBases (VictoriaMetrics, Prometheus, InfluxDB)

Senior\Lead Backend Engineers Node.JS (Relocation to Finland or Remote)

We have a distributed system based on cloud platforms and services that we would like to develop above and beyond. As a part of the development team, you will be adding new features to the existing product. You will work with AWS Services, such as Kinesis, Redshift, SQS, etc., and other cloud solutions suitable for high-loaded systems. We are looking developers into several squads of the company ‚Äî both customer-faced products and internal ecosystem development.

Who you are

If you consider yourself an eager learner, a conscientious worker, and a thoughtful, kind, supportive human, we‚Äôre happy to accept you. You like to communicate proactively all the challenges ahead, making sure that all the expectations around are aligned properly. And of course, you like coding.

We‚Äôre looking for a skilled backend developer who would like to work for an international company that gives developers freedom, respect, flexible hours.

    5+ years of experience in web development, including decent experience in backend
    Fluent Russian speaker, as our development team speaks Russian mostly
    Solid understanding of how distributed systems are built and web technologies in general
    You know the aspects of OOP, FP, SOLID, DRY and use them wisely
    Knowledge of some application design and development patterns and principles and the ability to apply them
    Good understanding of how to debug and profile the code, find bottlenecks in performance
    Ability and willingness to take ownership of some parts of the system
    Ability to write in English; speaking and fluency is a huge plus
    A can-do attitude and willingness to learn a lot in a short time (i.e., can you handle the guaranteed high demands on your brainpower?)
    A great team player who is able to share their work with their teammates and solve big problems in cooperation
    Good analytical skills, ability to make truthful conclusions on problems and their causes

It's also natural for you to ask questions and say if there's something you're not that familiar with yet. There is always room to grow and learn, and you don't need to be perfect, no-one is. This is how we see honesty and humanity.

Benefits

    Competitive salary, starting from 4500 EUR
    Relocation to Finland
    Mobile phone benefit and paid home internet connection
    Reimbursement of expenses for professional books and courses related to work
    Reimbursement of expenses related to visiting conferences and professional events
    Partial compensation for English language courses costs (60%)
    Flexible hours - you choose when to work and from where
    Friendly environment

Senior Java Engineer, Banking System;
 
We offer a $2,000 Sign-on bonus to the specialist that will accept our offer and join DataArt in this position. $2,000 will be included in the first salary.
 
Must have
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in the development of web applications
‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of Java
‚Ä¢ Experience in the development of applications using the Java Enterprise platform
‚Ä¢ Experience working with databases (Oracle or PostgreSQL)
‚Ä¢ Experience with object-oriented programming (OOP), object-oriented design (OOD), and design patterns
‚Ä¢ Experience using test-driven development (TDD)
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Spring and Spring Boot frameworks
‚Ä¢ Experience implementing microservices
‚Ä¢ Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of build tools (Gradle, Maven)
‚Ä¢ Experienced team worker
‚Ä¢ Spoken English
 
Would be a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with API gateways, such as APIGee, AWS API Gateway
 
Our client is a British bank, one of the largest finance companies in the world. The bank was founded three centuries ago, and today its assets are estimated at trillions of US dollars.
 
Throughout its history, the bank has offered various banking products to clients. Its technical support has become more complex and expensive due to the expansion of its product line and the growth of its customer base. The development of technologies has led to a growth in customer expectations for banking apps as well as the automatization of bank account interactions. Therefore, it became clear that all the IT systems of our client needed an upgrade. Now they have been improved in accordance with modern technologies, and the user interfaces of the apps have been modernized as well; the DataArt team is now working on closer integration of the apps. An incredible amount of paperwork with which the specialists of the bank are engaged is going to be automated and transferred to electronic format.
 
DataArt's experts together with developers on the client's side are creating new banking apps and upgrading the old ones. In particular, there is a custom client portal project, which aggregates all user information and allows users to switch easily between the various banking products.
 
Working on this project will provide you an opportunity to participate in the technological modernization of a large financial institution, creating a product that will have millions of users, and obtain relevant experience in agile software development.
